description: This show is intended for architects who have experience building infrastructure and applications on the Microsoft Azure platform. You should have a good understanding of most services offered on the Azure platform. After completing this course, you will be able to: Describe Azure architecture components, including infrastructure, tools, and portals; Create and deploy Azure Resource Manager (ARM) templates for various all-up solutions; Compare and contrast various infrastructure, serverless, database and communication services; such as App Services, Virtual Machine Scale Sets, Azure Cosmos DB, SQL Database, and Container Service in Azure; Incorporate various Azure platform services, such as Cognitive Services and Media Servicers into an overall Azure solution; Secure, monitor and backup solutions deployed to Azure; Create automated DevOps solutions using a combination of ARM templates, configuration management utilities, Azure CLI, and the Cloud Shell.
descriptionMD:
This show is intended for architects who have experience building infrastructure and applications on the Microsoft Azure platform. You should have a good understanding of most services offered on the Azure platform. After completing this course, you will be able to:

+ Describe Azure architecture components, including infrastructure, tools, and portals.  
+ Create and deploy Azure Resource Manager (ARM) templates for various all-up solutions.
+ Compare and contrast various infrastructure, serverless, database and communication services; such as App Services, Virtual Machine Scale Sets, Azure Cosmos DB, SQL Database, and Container Service in Azure.
+ Incorporate various Azure platform services, such as Cognitive Services and Media Servicers into an overall Azure solution.
+ Secure, monitor and backup solutions deployed to Azure.
+ Create automated DevOps solutions using a combination of ARM templates, configuration management utilities, Azure CLI, and the Cloud Shell.
name: Architecting Microsoft Azure Solutions - 70-535
subtitle: Microsoft Azure

episodes.description: Adam and Wes discuss what to expect when preparing to take the Architecting Microsoft Azure Solutions 70-535 exam.
episodes.title: Overview
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:05.891
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:05.891 --> 00:00:06.850
Hello and welcome.

3
00:00:06.850 --> 00:00:09.728
Thank you for
tuning in to the 70-535 series.

4
00:00:09.728 --> 00:00:12.280
That's right,
Architecting Microsoft Azure Solutions.

5
00:00:12.280 --> 00:00:15.523
We'd like to take a moment here and
tell you what you can expect in some of

6
00:00:15.523 --> 00:00:17.701
the topics in the videos
that are gonna follow.

7
00:00:17.701 --> 00:00:19.635
Here to help us with that is Adam Gordon.

8
00:00:19.635 --> 00:00:20.685
Adam, how we doing today, sir?

9
00:00:20.685 --> 00:00:21.445
>> Doing well, how about you?

10
00:00:21.445 --> 00:00:21.985
>> Doing good.

11
00:00:21.985 --> 00:00:22.603
So what kind of

12
00:00:22.603 --> 00:00:25.916
topics can we expect in the Architecting
Microsoft Azure Solution series?

13
00:00:25.916 --> 00:00:28.931
>> So we're gonna cover, actually,
quite a bit of ground in this show.

14
00:00:28.931 --> 00:00:31.686
We've got six main topic
areas we're gonna cover.

15
00:00:31.686 --> 00:00:34.227
We're actually throwing
in a bonus seventh area.

16
00:00:34.227 --> 00:00:36.317
Not part of the exam
objectives overall but

17
00:00:36.317 --> 00:00:39.660
very important from a foundational
knowledge perspective.

18
00:00:39.660 --> 00:00:42.336
Join me here and let's take a quick
look at what we are gonna do and

19
00:00:42.336 --> 00:00:43.710
how we're gonna do it.

20
00:00:43.710 --> 00:00:49.984
Architecting Microsoft Azure Solutions
70-535 exam went live in November 30th,

21
00:00:49.984 --> 00:00:55.448
very end of November 2017, depending
on when you're watching this show.

22
00:00:55.448 --> 00:00:59.817
It's still available, certainly,
available in, as you can see,

23
00:00:59.817 --> 00:01:02.240
English and other languages as well.

24
00:01:02.240 --> 00:01:07.202
And it's gonna give you credit
towards the MCP, the MCSA Cloud and

25
00:01:07.202 --> 00:01:11.897
MCSE Cloud, along with MCSD if
you are doing the complete Azure

26
00:01:11.897 --> 00:01:15.723
track including
the Developing Azure Solutions.

27
00:01:15.723 --> 00:01:19.466
We're just focusing right now
on the architecture exam.

28
00:01:19.466 --> 00:01:22.090
When we scroll down here,
we will see the skills measured.

29
00:01:22.090 --> 00:01:26.410
You can see the main objective varies,
each of these has substantial

30
00:01:26.410 --> 00:01:29.250
numbers of sub-objective
categories associated with them.

31
00:01:29.250 --> 00:01:33.616
Rest assured, we will be going through
every one of them in painstaking and

32
00:01:33.616 --> 00:01:38.054
excruciating detail, as you will see
based on the overall episode count and

33
00:01:38.054 --> 00:01:40.776
amount of time we devote
to discussions here.

34
00:01:40.776 --> 00:01:44.732
But the six main areas, Design and
Compute Infrastructure,

35
00:01:44.732 --> 00:01:49.309
we'll take a look at everything and
all things Azure VM and VM related.

36
00:01:49.309 --> 00:01:54.575
Up to 25% of the overall exam objective
questions come from this one category,

37
00:01:54.575 --> 00:01:57.642
and one of the main areas for
exam preparation.

38
00:01:57.642 --> 00:02:01.020
Designing Data Implementation,
all things data.

39
00:02:01.020 --> 00:02:04.570
We'll be talking about storage and all the
different types of storage solutions we

40
00:02:04.570 --> 00:02:09.350
use to create manage and
ultimately maintain data in our systems.

41
00:02:09.350 --> 00:02:11.030
We'll take a look at storage accounts.

42
00:02:11.030 --> 00:02:14.988
We'll talk about relational and
non-relational database types and

43
00:02:14.988 --> 00:02:16.204
how we manage those.

44
00:02:16.204 --> 00:02:19.150
Some really interesting and
fascinating stuff going on there.

45
00:02:19.150 --> 00:02:21.384
Designing Networking Implementations.

46
00:02:21.384 --> 00:02:25.451
We'll be taking a look at all of the
connectivity that we need to create and

47
00:02:25.451 --> 00:02:28.206
the systems associated
with that connectivity to

48
00:02:28.206 --> 00:02:30.829
be able to work with
compute infrastructure and

49
00:02:30.829 --> 00:02:34.521
manage data by accessing it once
we have infrastructure enabled.

50
00:02:34.521 --> 00:02:38.249
We'll take a look at subnetting,
not subnetting overall but subnets,

51
00:02:38.249 --> 00:02:39.220
I should say.

52
00:02:39.220 --> 00:02:41.430
We'll throw a little bit of
subnetting in there as well.

53
00:02:41.430 --> 00:02:45.520
We'll talk about VNets, so
virtual networks and subnets within them.

54
00:02:45.520 --> 00:02:47.938
We'll talk about public and
private IP address.

55
00:02:47.938 --> 00:02:52.515
We'll talk about NATting, we'll talk
about WAFs, web application firewalls.

56
00:02:52.515 --> 00:02:55.063
We'll talk about VPNs, point-to-site,

57
00:02:55.063 --> 00:02:57.953
site-to-site and
ExpressRoute connectivity.

58
00:02:57.953 --> 00:03:00.994
We'll take a look at UDRs,
User Defined Routes, and

59
00:03:00.994 --> 00:03:04.386
all sorts of other implementation
solutions in that area.

60
00:03:04.386 --> 00:03:07.067
Design and Security and
Identity Solutions.

61
00:03:07.067 --> 00:03:11.080
We'll take a look at everything security
and everything identity related.

62
00:03:11.080 --> 00:03:15.659
Meaning, the Security Center and all
the solutions that we have associated with

63
00:03:15.659 --> 00:03:20.650
securing and managing our infrastructure,
role-based access control, RBAC.

64
00:03:20.650 --> 00:03:24.007
We'll take a look at IAM,
Identity and Access Management.

65
00:03:24.007 --> 00:03:28.003
The ability to assign users, groups,
and/or applications and service principal

66
00:03:28.003 --> 00:03:32.220
identities, rights to be able to interact
with manage and user infrastructure.

67
00:03:32.220 --> 00:03:36.066
We'll talk about and we'll take a look
at the different Active directory

68
00:03:36.066 --> 00:03:40.470
implementation options that we have
available to us, both on-prem, cloud only,

69
00:03:40.470 --> 00:03:41.725
and a hybrid solution.

70
00:03:41.725 --> 00:03:43.996
And we'll take a look at Azure AD Connect,

71
00:03:43.996 --> 00:03:48.542
which is the newest iteration of Directory
Sync and earlier versions of the directory

72
00:03:48.542 --> 00:03:52.290
replication and management tool
sets that we need to work with.

73
00:03:52.290 --> 00:03:54.050
We'll implement that solution and

74
00:03:54.050 --> 00:03:57.560
show you how to manage on-prem
hybrid infrastructure.

75
00:03:57.560 --> 00:04:00.335
Designing Solutions by
using Platform Services.

76
00:04:00.335 --> 00:04:04.776
This is where we get into a lot of
the very specific interesting but

77
00:04:04.776 --> 00:04:08.897
siloed solutions that are available
on the Azure platform,

78
00:04:08.897 --> 00:04:13.666
machine learning, Microsoft's
artificial intelligence, or AI,

79
00:04:13.666 --> 00:04:17.610
capabilities overall with
Cognitive Services APIs.

80
00:04:17.610 --> 00:04:21.590
We'll take a look at IoT,
Internet of Things capabilities.

81
00:04:21.590 --> 00:04:25.864
Really, extending broadly and
widely and deeply our management and

82
00:04:25.864 --> 00:04:27.936
our data capabilities overall.

83
00:04:27.936 --> 00:04:31.138
We'll take a look at things
like Stream Analytics,

84
00:04:31.138 --> 00:04:33.440
the Azure IoT Hub, the Event Hub.

85
00:04:33.440 --> 00:04:37.790
We'll take a look at Event Grid,
we'll take a look at notification hubs.

86
00:04:37.790 --> 00:04:40.780
We'll talk about the Data Lake Factory.

87
00:04:40.780 --> 00:04:45.550
The Data Lake analytics solutions between
this area and data implementation.

88
00:04:45.550 --> 00:04:50.487
Lots of very, very big, very broad,
global spanning infrastructures solutions

89
00:04:50.487 --> 00:04:54.012
that allow us to measure,
manage, and maintain data, and

90
00:04:54.012 --> 00:04:58.472
implement infrastructure, and
then manage it across the entire fabric.

91
00:04:58.472 --> 00:05:00.700
And, finally, Design for Operations.

92
00:05:00.700 --> 00:05:05.390
We'll take a look at how we monitor,
oversee, and maintain infrastructure.

93
00:05:05.390 --> 00:05:11.090
We'll talk about and look at log analytics
and the OMS, the Ops Management workspace,

94
00:05:11.090 --> 00:05:14.860
which is an extension of
the Systems Center Ops Manager platform

95
00:05:14.860 --> 00:05:18.660
brought into Azure and
created for our use inline.

96
00:05:18.660 --> 00:05:21.340
We'll be able to look at data
from a variety of perspectives,

97
00:05:21.340 --> 00:05:25.395
including automation and configuration
management capabilities using both

98
00:05:25.395 --> 00:05:31.010
built-in solutions, like Desired State
Configuration built right into Azure, as

99
00:05:31.010 --> 00:05:34.910
well as the ability to manage both Linux
and Windows-based systems as a result.

100
00:05:34.910 --> 00:05:38.317
We'll look at third-party solutions,
Chef and Puppet and

101
00:05:38.317 --> 00:05:40.254
a variety of other interactive and

102
00:05:40.254 --> 00:05:45.226
oversight capabilities that we have with
these configuration management platforms.

103
00:05:45.226 --> 00:05:48.341
All of that are the exam objective
categories that are there.

104
00:05:48.341 --> 00:05:51.500
I promised you a seventh bonus one,
which is not listed.

105
00:05:51.500 --> 00:05:55.447
But if you take a look right below the
overview that we're going through right

106
00:05:55.447 --> 00:05:58.421
now in the library, and
start going in order in this area,

107
00:05:58.421 --> 00:06:00.744
you will see that we
have a seventh category.

108
00:06:00.744 --> 00:06:04.844
It's the very first one we've created,
and it's gonna be all about cloud design

109
00:06:04.844 --> 00:06:07.519
patterns and
our ability to be able to walk through and

110
00:06:07.519 --> 00:06:11.104
examine the eight categories of
cloud design architecture patterns.

111
00:06:11.104 --> 00:06:13.208
And put them into perspective for you,

112
00:06:13.208 --> 00:06:17.355
with regards to how they form the baseline
and the foundational knowledge for

113
00:06:17.355 --> 00:06:21.499
all these other areas in order to fully
prepare you and in order to fully center

114
00:06:21.499 --> 00:06:25.871
you in the middle of our conversations
around how we architect Azure solutions.

115
00:06:25.871 --> 00:06:27.915
Look forward to walking
through all that with you.

116
00:06:27.915 --> 00:06:30.729
Hopefully you're gonna be able to spend
time with us going through each and

117
00:06:30.729 --> 00:06:32.540
every one of those
episodes in the library.

118
00:06:32.540 --> 00:06:35.310
But whether you pick and
choose selectively to fill in the gaps or

119
00:06:35.310 --> 00:06:38.390
you go through it end to end,
lot of exciting content.

120
00:06:38.390 --> 00:06:41.815
And all you have to is shut this overview
off and jump right into the library and

121
00:06:41.815 --> 00:06:43.245
start going through it with us.

122
00:06:43.245 --> 00:06:44.395
I look forward to seeing you there.

123
00:06:44.395 --> 00:06:50.409
[MUSIC]
